alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 5:09PM MDT until August 13 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Big Horn County in south central Montana... Southwestern Yellowstone County in south central Montana... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 506 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Shepherd to 9 miles north of Pryor, moving east at 35 mph. The main threat is the wind outflow ahead of the storms. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. At 437 PM, 64 mph wind gust was reported near Molt. At 505 PM, Billings airport weather station reported a wind gust of 58 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Billings, Hardin, Lockwood, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Fort Smith, Billings West End, Ballantine, Pompeys Pillar, St. Xavier and Crow Indian Reservation. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
